alert.note: Alert for Central Siskiyou County (California) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Medford (Southwest Oregon and Northern California)
info.headline: Winter Weather Advisory issued February 22 at 12:53PM PST until February 24 at 10:00AM PST by NWS Medford
info.description: ...WINTER STORM WARNING IN EFFECT FROM 4 PM THURSDAY TO 10 AM PST FRIDAY... ...WINTER WEATHER ADVISORY IN EFFECT FROM 4 PM THURSDAY TO 10 AM PST FRIDAY... ...WINTER WEATHER ADVISORY IS CANCELLED... * WHAT...For the Winter Storm Warning, heavy snow expected. Total snow accumulations of 6 to 10 inches, with up to 12 inches just south of Weed. For the Winter Weather Advisory, snow expected. Total snow accumulation 3 to 6 inches. * WHERE...For the Winter Storm Warning, Interstate 5 near Weed and highway 97 northeast of Weed. For the Winter Weather Advisory, Interstate 5 from Gazelle to near Weed. * WHEN...From 4 PM Thursday to 10 AM PST Friday. * IMPACTS...Travel could be very difficult. The hazardous conditions could impact the morning or evening commute. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS...Snowfall rates Thursday night could approach an inch per hour near Weed and highway 97 Thursday night. * View the hazard area in detail at https://www.wrh.noaa.gov/map/?wfo=mfr
info.instruction: * Travel is strongly discouraged because of dangerous conditions. * If you must travel, keep tire chains, a flashlight, blankets, food, water, medications, and a fully charged phone with you. * The safest place during a winter storm is indoors. * A Winter Storm Warning means that severe winter weather is likely and poses a threat to life and property. Take protective action now. * A Winter Weather Advisory for snow means that periods of snow will cause travel difficulties.
